quotes: was released on 10 April 2007. It was Iglesias's highest-charting song on the Billboard Hot 100 since 'Escape'.
On 4 July 2007, Iglesias became the first Western artist to play a concert in Syria in three decades when he performed for a sold-out crowd of ten thousand in the capital Damascus.
He performed the song live at the 29 June 2008 final in Vienna, Austria.
Iglesias released a Spanish greatest hits album titled 95/08 Éxitos on 25 March 2008, which included his seventeen number-one songs on the Billboard Hot Latin Songs chart plus two new songs.

organizations.name: Billboard
quotes: was released on 10 April 2007. It was Iglesias's highest-charting song on the Billboard Hot 100 since 'Escape'.
The Spanish version of the song, titled 'Dímelo', was number one on the Billboard Hot Latin Songs chart for eleven weeks.
Iglesias released a Spanish greatest hits album titled 95/08 Éxitos on 25 March 2008, which included his seventeen number-one songs on the Billboard Hot Latin Songs chart plus two new songs.

organizations.name: Live Earth
quotes: and in the same week, he performed on Live Earth in Hamburg.

organizations.name: UEFA Euro 2008
quotes: Iglesias's song 'Can You Hear Me' was chosen as the official song of the UEFA Euro 2008 football tournament.
The song was also a hit throughout Europe, peaking in the top 10 in many countries.
In Europe, the second single was 'Tired of Being Sorry', which performed well in many countries;
he recorded a version of the song with French singer Nâdiya, which was number one in France for eleven weeks.
On 4 July 2007, Iglesias became the first Western artist to play a concert in Syria in three decades when he performed for a sold-out crowd of ten thousand in the capital Damascus.

It was his first arena tour of the UK, with him playing venues such as Manchester's MEN Arena and Wembley Arena.
